abstract: Home Depot reached a tentative new agreement today to sell its wholesale unit to a consortium of private equity firms for a reduced price of $8.5 billion, according to people involved  in the deal.
snippet: Home Depot reached a tentative new agreement today to sell its wholesale unit to a consortium of private equity firms for a reduced price of $8.5 billion, according to people involved  in the deal.
lead_paragraph: In one of the most closely watched deals on Wall Street, Home Depot reached a tentative new agreement today to sell its wholesale unit to a consortium of private equity firms for a reduced price of $8.5 billion, according to people involved in the transaction.

headline.main: Home Depot Is Said to Cut Deal’s Price by $1.8 Billion
headline.print_headline: Home Depot Is Said to Cut Deal’s Price by $1.8 Billion

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced
